label: AI-Powered Site Search
description: Semantic search with ML-powered ranking delivering 40-70% improvement in search conversion through intelligent query understanding and result relevance.

traditional.workflow: 1. Site search uses basic keyword matching (exact text match required). 2. Results ranked by simple relevance score (title match > description match). 3. Misspellings return zero results (no spell correction). 4. Synonyms not understood ('sneakers' doesn't return 'athletic shoes'). 5. Poor search experience yields 15-25% search conversion and 20-30% zero-result rate.
constraints: Keyword matching misses semantic meaning ('running shoes for flat feet' fails)
20-30% searches return zero results due to spelling, synonyms, product naming
No query understanding (can't distinguish 'apple' fruit vs Apple tech)
Results ranked by text match not business value or customer preference
15-25% search conversion due to poor result relevance
No learning from search engagement and conversions

agentic.workflow: 1. Query Understanding Agent interprets search intent using NLP: semantic meaning not just keywords, entity recognition (brands, product types, attributes), spell correction and autocomplete, synonym expansion ('sneakers' includes 'athletic shoes'). 2. ML Ranking Agent scores results by: predicted relevance to user's intent, personalized based on user preferences, business rules (margin, inventory, promotions), engagement signals (clicks, conversions). 3. Result Enhancement Agent enriches listings with images, ratings, availability. 4. Learning Agent continuously improves from search engagement and outcomes. 5. Zero-Result Recovery suggests alternatives when no exact match.
dataSources: Search query logs and engagement data
Product catalog with attributes and metadata
benefits: 40-70% improvement in search conversion through relevant results
Zero-result rate reduced to <5% via spell correction and synonyms
Semantic understanding handles natural language queries
Personalized ranking shows products aligned with user preferences
Continuous ML learning improves relevance over time
Business-aware ranking balances relevance with margin and inventory

quickWins: Implement spell correction and synonym expansion
Deploy ML ranking for search results
prerequisites: Search platform with ML ranking capability

label: Natural Language Query Understanding
description: Conversational search understanding complex queries and intent delivering 50-80% improvement in long-tail search effectiveness.

traditional.workflow: 1. Search requires structured keywords ('red dress size 8'). 2. Natural language queries fail ('I need a formal dress for my daughter's wedding next month'). 3. Compound queries with multiple attributes return poor results. 4. No understanding of context, intent, or qualifiers. 5. Users must learn to search in 'computer language' not natural language.
constraints: Natural language queries fail (must use structured keywords)
Long descriptive searches ('cocktail dress for summer outdoor wedding') return zero results
Can't understand intent or context (occasion, season, recipient)
Compound attribute queries difficult ('waterproof hiking boots under $100')
60-70% of natural language queries fail or return poor results
Mobile voice search nearly unusable due to conversational nature

agentic.workflow: 1. NLP Parser Agent decomposes natural language query into structured intent: product type ('dress'), attributes ('formal', 'red', 'size 8'), context ('wedding', 'next month'), constraints ('under $150'). 2. Intent Classification Agent determines search purpose (research vs buy, gift vs self, occasion). 3. Entity Extraction identifies brands, categories, sizes, colors, materials. 4. Query Expansion enriches with synonyms and related terms. 5. Conversational Follow-up enables refinement ('show me cheaper options', 'in blue instead').
dataSources: Product catalog with attributes and taxonomy
benefits: 50-80% improvement in long-tail search effectiveness
Natural language queries handled successfully (85-95% vs 30-40%)
Voice search becomes viable (70-85% success vs 20-30%)
Context-aware results match intent not just keywords
Conversational refinement enables iterative search
Mobile users can search naturally without typing structured queries

quickWins: Implement entity extraction for key attributes
Deploy query expansion for natural language

label: Faceted Search & Filtering
description: AI-powered facet recommendations with smart filtering reducing time to find products by 50-70% through intelligent navigation.

traditional.workflow: 1. All available facets shown in sidebar (20-30 options overwhelming users). 2. Same facets for all searches regardless of query or category. 3. No guidance on which facets narrow results effectively. 4. Facet order fixed (not optimized for user's search). 5. Users must manually trial-and-error to find relevant filters.
constraints: 20-30 facets overwhelm users (analysis paralysis)
Generic facets not relevant to specific search context
No indication of result counts before applying filter (dead-end filtering)
Facet order not optimized for user's likely refinement path
50-60% users abandon after failing to narrow 1000+ results
Mobile users especially struggle with long facet lists

agentic.workflow: 1. Facet Relevance Agent selects most relevant facets for search context (show 'size' for shoes, 'cuisine' for restaurants). 2. Smart Ordering Agent prioritizes facets by: result set diversity (which facets split results meaningfully), user behavior patterns, predicted next refinement. 3. Result Count Preview shows counts before applying filter (avoids dead-ends). 4. Guided Filtering suggests optimal facet combinations to narrow results. 5. Progressive Disclosure shows additional facets as users refine (not all 30 upfront).
benefits: 50-70% reduction in time to find products through smart filtering
Facet usage increases to 60-80% vs 30-40% (better discoverability)
Filter abandonment reduced to 15-25% vs 50-60%
Context-relevant facets (not generic 30-facet list)
Result count preview prevents dead-end filtering
Progressive disclosure reduces cognitive load on mobile

quickWins: Add result count preview to facets

label: Search Autocomplete & Suggestions
description: ML-powered autocomplete with personalized suggestions reducing search effort by 40-60% and increasing conversion through guided discovery.

traditional.workflow: 1. Autocomplete shows top 10 most popular queries starting with typed letters. 2. Same suggestions for all users (not personalized). 3. Suggestions text-only (no images or context). 4. No product or category suggestions (only query completions). 5. Generic popular queries not relevant to individual user intent.
constraints: Popular query autocomplete not personalized to user preferences
Text-only suggestions lack visual context
No product or category suggestions (must complete full search)
Mobile users must type entire query (autocomplete doesn't include products)
Suggestions don't guide discovery (just complete common searches)
40-50% users ignore autocomplete due to irrelevance

agentic.workflow: 1. Personalized Suggestion Agent tailors autocomplete to user: recent searches and browsing, category preferences, trending searches in user's segment. 2. Multi-Type Suggestions shows mix of: query completions, product matches, category suggestions, brand suggestions. 3. Visual Enrichment adds product images and ratings to suggestions. 4. Zero-Typing Discovery enables clicking suggestion without typing full query. 5. Learning Agent improves suggestions based on selection and conversion outcomes.
dataSources: Product catalog with images and ratings
benefits: 40-60% reduction in typing effort through smart autocomplete
Autocomplete usage increases to 75-85% vs 50-60%
Zero-typing discovery (click product from suggestions without search)
Personalized suggestions increase relevance and conversion 30-50%
Visual product suggestions enable image-based selection
Trending and popular queries aid discovery of new products

label: Visual Search & Image Recognition
description: AI-powered visual search enabling product discovery from images delivering 3-5x engagement and tapping into the 70%+ of users who struggle with text descriptions.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customers must describe products in words (difficult for visual items like fashion, decor). 2. No image-based search capability. 3. Users screenshot products from social media but can't search with image. 4. Complex visual attributes hard to describe ('dress with abstract floral print, empire waist'). 5. Missed discovery opportunity for visually-oriented shoppers.
constraints: Text descriptions inadequate for visual products (fashion, home decor, furniture)
Can't search using images from Instagram, Pinterest, real world photos
Visual attributes difficult to articulate in words
70%+ of users struggle to describe style preferences textually
Social media product discovery doesn't connect to purchase
Mobile users want to snap photo and find similar products

agentic.workflow: 1. Image Recognition Agent analyzes uploaded or camera-captured images: product type and category, visual attributes (color, pattern, style, material), brand and logo detection, similar product matching. 2. Visual Similarity Search finds products matching visual characteristics. 3. Attribute Extraction translates visual elements into searchable attributes. 4. Shop-the-Look identifies multiple products in single image (outfit, room setup). 5. Results ranked by visual similarity and availability.
dataSources: Product catalog with images and visual attributes
benefits: 3-5x engagement from visual discovery vs text search
70%+ of visually-oriented shoppers can now search effectively
Social media inspiration becomes shoppable (Instagram → visual search → purchase)
Mobile camera search enables real-world product finding
Shop-the-look increases AOV 40-80% through outfit/room bundling
Reduces search frustration for hard-to-describe visual items

quickWins: Pilot visual search for fashion category

label: Search Personalization & Merchandising
description: Unified search personalization with merchandising controls balancing customer relevance and business goals achieving 35-65% conversion improvement.

traditional.workflow: 1. Search results ranked by text relevance only (ignores business goals). 2. Merchandiser wants to promote new collection but search algorithm doesn't comply. 3. No ability to boost/bury products in search results. 4. Clearance items appear above full-price (bad for margin). 5. Conflict between algorithmic relevance and business merchandising needs.
constraints: Pure algorithmic ranking ignores business rules (margin, inventory, promotions)
Can't boost strategic products (new arrivals, high margin, exclusive)
Low-margin clearance items rank high due to popularity
No seasonal merchandising control (swimwear in winter)
Out-of-stock items appear prominently (poor experience)
Merchandiser and algorithm work against each other

agentic.workflow: 1. Hybrid Ranking Agent balances multiple signals: personal relevance (user preferences, history), textual relevance (query match), business rules (margin, inventory, promotions, seasonality). 2. Merchandising Control allows: boosting/burying specific products or categories, seasonal campaigns and new arrival promotion, inventory-aware ranking (de-rank out-of-stock). 3. Margin Optimization favors higher-margin items when relevance similar. 4. A/B Testing validates business rule impact on conversion and revenue. 5. Dynamic Weighting adjusts signal importance by query and user.
dataSources: Product catalog with business attributes (margin, inventory)
A/B test results for ranking strategies
benefits: 35-65% conversion improvement through balanced relevance + business optimization
Merchandising control enables strategic product promotion
Margin optimization improves profitability 5-15% through smart ranking
Inventory-aware ranking prevents out-of-stock disappointment
Seasonal and campaign support without sacrificing relevance
A/B testing ensures business rules improve (not hurt) customer experience

quickWins: Add inventory availability to search ranking
prerequisites: Search platform with business rules capability
Product catalog with margin and inventory data
